result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 55 days sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA surcharge and Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

From the defendant requesting the opportunity to participate in the Early Release Program.
  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 8/6/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.
  **Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 8/11: Denied. The defendant does not set forth a new factor upon which to justify a sentence modification. **

Certified copy of 11/15/17 order.
It is ordered that the judgment of conviction and the order denying sentence modification are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
It is further ordered that Attorney Jon Alfonso LaMendola is relieved from further representing Miller in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
It is further order that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Christopher L Miller in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. The Court strikes the repeater and finds the Defendant guilty.  The Court orders a PSI be prepared and filed with the Court in 30 days.  The Court revokes bail.    The Court schedules the matter for sentencing in 45 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court.   Defendant Christopher L Miller did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mcmurray advises the Court the Defendant has not been able to transportation to Court today.  The Court issues but stays a capias until Wednesday, April 27 at 9:30 a.m.  The Court adjourns the trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
